content: I'm proving that a perfect normal space is a completely normal space, which involves an argument concerning two arbitrary separated sets (the closure of each one misses the other set). The necessary construction for one works for the other by simply swapping the sets, which I think is the purpose of the wlog tactic, perhaps with generalizing? But I think I need a hint on where to learn more about how to use this tactic to DRY up my proofs.
I was going to look at it, but it doesn't build
No, the build is failing with error: ././././Mathlib/Topology/GDelta.lean:59:4: 'IsGÎ´' has already been declared

My instinct is that there are better solutions to this. Perhaps this is an indication that your lemmas about GDelta should not go in the file you're putting them in. People don't usually ask other people to look at files with unrelated errors in. I don't trust any file with an error in.
Sorry. I've deleted the distracting PR, which was not the point of my question. Is there any documentation on the use of the wlog tactic with generalizes?
Closing this as I found the need to factor out the repeated logic into its own lemm anyway.
Steven Clontz has marked this topic as resolved.
